channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Mon, 28 Oct 2024 00:17:37 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Cash-strapped Pakistan seeks additional 10 billion yuan loan from China: Report
item.description: Pakistan has sought an additional 10 billion yuan ($1.4 billion) loan from China as it has exhausted its current 30 billion yuan ($4.3 billion) trade facility. Finance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb requested an increase in the limits under the currency swap agreement, which would bring the total facility to about $5.

item.title: Indian dies trying to cross English Channel after small boat deflates
item.description: An Indian man died after a migrant boat deflated while attempting to cross the English Channel from France. The 40-year-old succumbed to cardiac arrest despite resuscitation efforts. This incident adds to a deadly year for channel crossings, with 56 migrant deaths recorded so far in 2023.

item.title: 45 killed in Gaza as ceasefire talks resume
item.description: Israeli military strikes have killed at least 45 Palestinians in Gaza, with the majority of casualties in the northern region. Amid escalating violence, CIA and Mossad directors are meeting with Qatar's PM in Doha, aiming for a short-term ceasefire and potential prisoner exchange between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: UNSC to meet today over Israeli strike: Diplomats
item.description: The United Nations Security Council is set to convene on Monday to address Israel's recent strike on Iran. Iran's foreign minister, Abbas Araqchi, labeled the attack a significant threat to global peace and security, calling for a legitimate response and highlighting the destabilization of the region.

item.title: One dead, 40 injured as truck rams a bus stop near Mossad HQ in Tel Aviv
item.description: One person was killed and around 40 were injured when a truck hit a bus stop near Tel Aviv in an apparent terrorist attack. The incident, near the Mossad headquarters and a military base, took place around 10 am. The driver, an Israeli Arab, was neutralized by a civilian. Investigations are ongoing to confirm terrorist motives.

item.title: Satellite images show damage at two secretive Iranian military bases
item.description: An Israeli airstrike targeted and caused damage to facilities at Iran's Parchin and Khojir military bases, known for their links to nuclear and ballistic missile programs. Iran has not acknowledged the damage, and no images have been released. Both bases are associated with past nuclear and current missile activities.

item.title: Israeli strike severely harmed Iran, achieved all its goals: Netanyahu
item.description: Israel's air strikes significantly targeted Iran's defence capabilities and missile production, says PM Netanyahu. Fighting continues in Lebanon between Israel and Hezbollah. Iranian leaders hint at retaliation, emphasizing their right to self-defence and warning of future responses. Heavy casualties reported in Sidon from Israeli air strikes.

item.title: Michelle appeals to men: 'Take our lives seriously'
item.description: Michelle Obama urged men to support Kamala Harris' presidential bid, warning that Trump's return could jeopardize women's healthcare. Highlighting the threat to abortion rights, Obama stressed the importance of this election for safeguarding the lives of women and their families.

item.title: 20 tied to Hasina's government get crimes tribunal summonses, to face genocide charges
item.description: Twenty individuals, including 10 former ministers and two advisers from Sheikh Hasina's ousted government, are ordered to appear before Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal on charges of crimes against humanity and genocide. The Awami League plans to mobilize street protests against what it calls a broad crackdown.

item.title: Baba Vanga and Nostradamus forecast: From prediction on Vladimir Putin's glory to alien encounters in 2025
item.description: Nostradamus and Baba Vanga both predict a devastating event in Europe by 2025, involving significant conflict. Vanga foresees extraterrestrials making contact and a new, mysterious energy source. She also projected Russia's future dominance under Putin and how his glory will remain untouched. She forecast Europe's Muslim rule by 2043 and communism's return by 2076.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump's interview with Joe Rogan breaks YouTube, gets 26 million views in just 24 hours
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump's recent appearance on Joe Rogan's podcast garnered over 26 million YouTube views in 24 hours. The three-hour interview covered Trump's political career, the 2020 election, an assassination attempt, and a controversial comparison. Rogan's podcast remains one of the most-watched globally.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Dem NSFW ad stirs debate painting GOP as extreme on porn censorship
item.description: Democratic groups, Progress Action Fund and Defend the Vote, released a provocative ad accusing Republicans of trying to ban porn nationwide. The ad has sparked controversy and mixed reactions on social media. Meanwhile, adult film stars launched a campaign targeting Republicans' proposed porn ban in Project 2025.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump rally at Madison Square Garden: List of street closures
item.description: NYPD tightens security at Madison Square Garden for a Trump and JD Vance rally on Sunday, urging public transit use due to road closures. Interim Police Commissioner Donlon assures safety, with heavy weapons teams and counterterrorism units on standby. Mayor Adams emphasizes zero tolerance for crime during expected protests. Trump aims to rally support ahead of the election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What time is Trump rally at Madison Square Garden in various USA time zones (ET, CT, MT, PT)?
item.description: Donald Trump will host a rally at Madison Square Garden in New York City, nine days before Election Day. The event, a major fundraising effort, aims to boost Republican congressional candidates and features key speakers such as Elon Musk and Rudy Giuliani. Tickets are limited to two per phone number and were available on Trump's campaign website.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'We struck the head of octopus': Netanyahu on Israel's air strike on Iran
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated the recent airstrike on Iran was precise, achieving its objectives. The strike was in retaliation to Iran's missile attack on Israel earlier in October, which was largely intercepted. Netanyahu emphasized Israel's commitment to retaliate decisively against any harm. Iran confirmed limited damage and four soldiers killed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine's air defence downed 41 of 80 Russian drones, military says
item.description: Ukraine's air defences successfully intercepted 41 of 80 Russian drones launched overnight. Although 32 drones remain unaccounted for, there were no reports of casualties or damage to critical infrastructure. President Zelenskiy highlighted Russia's relentless attacks, which included a significant number of guided aerial bombs, attack drones, and missiles over the past week.

item.title: Creative costumes, scary decorations, and more: World gears up for Halloween
Putin says Moscow will respond if West helps Ukraine to strike deep into Russia
item.description: President Putin announced that Russia's defence ministry is evaluating responses to potential US and Nato support for Ukrainian strikes deep into Russia using Western missiles. He regards such actions as a significant escalation, possibly involving Nato's direct participation. The Ukraine war has heightened tensions between Russia and the West.

item.title: More than 120 killed in paramilitary rampage in east-central Sudan, says UN, doctors group
item.description: Rapid Support Forces (RSF) fighters in Sudan wreaked havoc in Gezira province, resulting in over 120 deaths, sexual violence, and mass displacement. Clashes erupted between the RSF and Sudanese military, leading to severe human rights abuses and drawing international condemnation, with calls for immediate intervention.

item.title: 'Should not be exaggerated nor downplayed': Iran's supreme leader says on Israeli strikes, skips retaliation call
item.description: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei advised against exaggeration or downplaying of Israel's raids, avoiding direct calls for retaliation. The strikes, resulting in four Iranian casualties, were a response to Iran’s earlier missile attack, raising concerns of regional escalation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
